Articles.Content:
The problem: Docking large parts to a ship by a single port causes failure under acceleration.

The solution: If you could get two docking ports to align easily on multiple ships you could make more stable craft.

The suggestions: The easiest thing I can come up with is a couple template parts that add two connection points at say 2, 5 and 10 meters. Then docking ports of any size could be added to those points and you could use the template on other craft to ensure alignment. Another suggestion which would be even better but more work would be to have an additional "user" tab next to the science tab that let you drag and drop up to 5 assemblies (example) for use on other craft. You could build a docking port assembly or any other item, drag it to slot one in the user tab then open another craft and drag a copy of it out to that craft You could do a lot more than docking port assemblies this way. Pic demonstrates possible menu slots...I dont think a rendering of the item needs to be in each slot...maybe a small text pop up that's user defined.
That's why they made the dockingport Sr, and it does it'S intended job really well. Else, the new 2.5m adapter are pretty much the templates you need.
You can also make these with the new parts released in 0.21. As they now have quad couplers etc.
